bodydiv.p: In principle, determining an expected present value involves the following steps:

li.p: measuring the present value of the cash flows in that scenario—paragraphs BC185–BC205B discuss the discount rate; and
estimating the probability of that scenario occurring.

bodydiv.p: Consistent with the approach taken in IFRS 9, the Board decided to specify that an entity should use reasonable and supportable information available without undue cost or effort in determining an expected present value.
